name: global_brand
label: /// Start Here: Colors & Fonts
help_text: Set your brand colors here. Don't worry, you'll have the option to set these on a each element in the options below should you need to customize something specific.

children.name: primary_color
children.label: Primary (Pop!) color
children.help_text: Pop colors are those in your brand guide that will POP off the page. If you have bright colors as part of your brand, use those.

children.name: secondary_color
children.label: Secondary (Pop!) color
children.help_text: Pop colors are those in your brand guide that will POP off the page. If you have bright colors as part of your brand, use those.

children.name: tertiary_color
children.label: Tertiary (Pop!) color
children.help_text: Pop colors are those in your brand guide that will POP off the page. If you have bright colors as part of your brand, use those.

children.name: default_heading_font
children.label: Default Heading Font
children.help_text: This will set the default of all the headings (H1, H2, etc.) below. But don't worry, you'll still be able to set custom ones if you so choose.

children.name: default_body_font
children.label: Default Body Font
children.help_text: This will set the default for all paragraphs, lists, labels, etc. Basically, anything that isn't a headline.

children.name: font_style
children.label: Font Styles
children.help_text: This font style for the header. Within the Global Header Module you will be able to set the color according to the other style options.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: font_style
children.label: Font Styles
children.help_text: This font style for the footer. Within the Global Footer Module you will be able to set the color according to the other style options.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: font_style
children.label: Font Styles
children.help_text: NOTE: There is a seperate color setting for the text inside the CLEAN Hero Banner Module making the text white. The color setting here will control all other H1's on the page.

children.name: size_mobile
children.label: Font Size (Mobile/Tablet)
children.help_text: This will allow you to set the font for smaller devices. Typically, you'll want to set the size a bit smaller.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: line_height
children.label: Line Height
children.help_text: This will control the vertical space between each line of text. It's set in EMs so you'll want to use decimals to set it. Somewhere between 1.0 and 2.0 is usually good.

children.name: font_style
children.label: Font Styles
children.help_text: NOTE: There is a seperate color setting for the text inside the CLEAN Hero Banner Module making the text white. The color setting here will control all other H1's on the page.

children.help_text: This will allow you to set the font for smaller devices. Typically, you'll want to set the size a bit smaller.

children.help_text: NOTE: There is a seperate color setting for the text inside the CLEAN Hero Banner Module making the text white. The color setting here will control all other paragraphs on the page.

children.help_text: This will allow you to set the font for smaller devices. Typically, you'll want to set the size a bit smaller.

children.name: size_mobile

children.help_text: This will allow you to set the font for smaller devices. Typically, you'll want to set the size a bit smaller.

children.name: font_style
children.label: Font Styles
children.help_text: NOTE: There is a seperate color setting for the text inside the CLEAN Hero Banner Module making the text white. The color setting here will control all other blockquotes on the page.

children.name: size_mobile
children.label: Font Size (Mobile/Tablet)
children.help_text: This will allow you to set the font for smaller devices. Typically, you'll want to set the size a bit smaller.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: line_height
children.label: Line Height
children.help_text: This will control the vertical space between each line of text. It's set in EMs so you'll want to use decimals to set it. Somewhere between 1.0 and 2.0 is usually good.

children.name: border_width
children.label: Border Width
children.help_text: This will let you set the width of the border.

children.name: padding_left
children.label: Text Indent
children.help_text: This will let you set how much you want the text indented.

children.name: icons
children.label: Icon Style
children.help_text: This will set the global style for all the icons within the body of your page. In most cases, you'll also have custom control of these in each custom module.

children.name: divider
children.label: Accent Line
children.help_text: This will give you the ability to set the global style. You'll also have custom control of the color in each module.

children.name: line_width
children.label: Line Width
children.help_text: This will control how long the line is.

children.name: thickness
children.label: Line Thickness
children.help_text: This will control how thick the line is.

children.name: margin_bottom
children.label: Space Below (margin-bottom)
children.help_text: This will let you control how much space there is between the line and the content below.

children.name: cta_primary
children.label: CTA Primary (cta-primary)
children.help_text: When creating your CTAs in HubSpot you will want to use the CSS class of cta-primary to use this style. Check out the CLEAN docs for more info.

children.name: props
children.label: Button Style
children.help_text: The primary CTA should have the most visual weight of all the buttons on the page. Make this sucker POP!

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: corners
children.label: Rounded Corners
children.help_text: This will let you control the shape of the button. 0 will give you a square button where something closer to 50 will give you a pill shape.

children.name: p_top_btm
children.label: Padding (Top / Bottom)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button taller or shorter.

children.name: p_left_right
children.label: Padding (Left / Right)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button wider or more narrow.

children.name: add_expand_on_hover
children.label: Expand on Hover
children.help_text: By turning this on the button will subtly grow larger when someone hovers over it.

children.name: cta_secondary
children.label: CTA Secondary (cta-secondary)
children.help_text: When creating your CTAs in HubSpot you will want to use the CSS class of cta-secondary to use this style. Check out the CLEAN docs for more info.

children.name: props
children.label: Button Style
children.help_text: The secondary CTA should have the second most visual weight of all the buttons on the page. Make this sucker POP!

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: corners
children.label: Rounded Corners
children.help_text: This will let you control the shape of the button. 0 will give you a square button where something closer to 50 will give you a pill shape.

children.name: p_top_btm
children.label: Padding (Top / Bottom)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button taller or shorter.

children.name: p_left_right
children.label: Padding (Left / Right)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button wider or more narrow.

children.name: add_expand_on_hover
children.label: Expand on Hover
children.help_text: By turning this on the button will subtly grow larger when someone hovers over it.

children.name: cta_tertiary
children.label: CTA Tertiary (cta-tertiary)
children.help_text: When creating your CTAs in HubSpot you will want to use the CSS class of cta-tertiary to use this style. Check out the CLEAN docs for more info.

children.name: props
children.label: Button Style
children.help_text: The tertiary CTA should have the second most visual weight of all the buttons on the page. Make this sucker POP!

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: corners
children.label: Rounded Corners
children.help_text: This will let you control the shape of the button. 0 will give you a square button where something closer to 50 will give you a pill shape.

children.name: p_top_btm
children.label: Padding (Top / Bottom)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button taller or shorter.

children.name: p_left_right
children.label: Padding (Left / Right)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button wider or more narrow.

children.name: add_expand_on_hover
children.label: Expand on Hover
children.help_text: By turning this on the button will subtly grow larger when someone hovers over it.

children.name: form_submit
children.label: Submit Form Button
children.help_text: This will let you style the default form submit button.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: corners
children.label: Rounded Corners
children.help_text: This will let you control the shape of the button. 0 will give you a square button where something closer to 50 will give you a pill shape.

children.name: p_top_btm
children.label: Padding (Top / Bottom)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button taller or shorter.

children.name: p_left_right
children.label: Padding (Left / Right)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button wider or more narrow.

children.name: add_expand_on_hover
children.label: Expand on Hover
children.help_text: By turning this on the button will subtly grow larger when someone hovers over it.

children.name: form_submit_alt
children.label: Submit Form Button - Alt Vertion
children.help_text: When adding a form through one of the CLEAN modules, you'll have the option to use this alternative but style.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter. It's set in pixels so please use sparingly otherwise things will start looking goofy.

children.name: corners
children.label: Rounded Corners
children.help_text: This will let you control the shape of the button. 0 will give you a square button where something closer to 50 will give you a pill shape.

children.name: p_top_btm
children.label: Padding (Top / Bottom)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button taller or shorter.

children.name: p_left_right
children.label: Padding (Left / Right)
children.help_text: This setting will make the button wider or more narrow.

children.name: add_expand_on_hover
children.label: Expand on Hover
children.help_text: By turning this on the button will subtly grow larger when someone hovers over it.

children.name: form_input
children.label: Input Field
children.help_text: This will help you set the look and feel of each text input field.

children.name: border_color_focus
children.label: Border Color on Focus
children.help_text: When someone clicks into the input field the border will be highlighted.

children.name: border_radius
children.label: Corner Shape
children.help_text: For a square set this to 0. You will get more of a pill shape the closer you get to 50.

children.name: p_top_btm
children.label: Input Field Height (Padding top/bottom)
children.help_text: This will let you set the spacing above and below the text inside the field which will basically give you control of the height.

children.name: ph_color
children.label: Placeholder Text Color
children.help_text: If you have placeholder text in your form elements, this will control the color. Typically, you want this to be a subtle color shade.

children.name: form_label
children.label: Labels
children.help_text: This is the text that sits above each form element.

children.name: font_style
children.label: Font Styles
children.help_text: This will set the global styles. In some cases these label will adjust to the custom text color you are able to set in each custom module.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter.

children.name: line_height
children.label: Line Height
children.help_text: This will control the space between each line.

children.name: letter_spacing
children.label: Letter Spacing
children.help_text: This will control the space between each letter.

children.name: border_color
children.label: Border Color
children.help_text: This will add an alert color around the error message and the input field to let the person know which field needs their attention.

children.name: padding
children.label: Error Message Padding
children.help_text: This allows you to control the space around error message.

children.name: props
children.label: Style Options
children.help_text: This will let you control the style of the modal pop-up window.

children.name: modal_bg_color
children.label: Modal Background Color
children.help_text: This lets you set the background color of the modals content area.

children.name: overlay_bg_color
children.label: Overlay Background Color
children.help_text: This lets you set the color of the overlay that covers the webpages content.

children.name: p_top
children.label: Padding Top
children.help_text: This will let you set the space above the content.

children.name: p_bottom
children.label: Padding Bottom
children.help_text: This will let you set the space below the content.

children.name: standard_width
children.label: Standard Content Width
children.help_text: This lets you control the standard content width of the page. In each CLEAN Row module you'll have an option to select between full, standard, slim and custom width.

children.name: slim_width
children.label: Slim Content Width
children.help_text: This lets you control the slim content width of the page. In each CLEAN Row module you'll have an option to select between full, standard, slim and custom width.

children.name: blog_title_size
children.label: Main Blog Title Size
children.help_text: This will let you set the size of the font for the main title of your blog on the listing page.

children.name: blog_title_size_mobile
children.label: Main Blog Title Size (Mobile)
children.help_text: This will let you set the size of the font for the main title of your blog on the listing page for mobile browsers.

children.name: post_title_size
children.label: Post Title Size
children.help_text: This will let you set the size of the font for the post title of your blog on the post page.

children.name: post_title_size_mobile
children.label: Post Title Size (Mobile)
children.help_text: This will let you set the size of the font for the post title of your blog on the post page for mobile browsers.

children.name: post_title_padding_top
children.label: Space Above Post Title
children.help_text: This will let you adjust the amount of spacing above at the top of the post.

children.name: post_body_size
children.label: Paragraph Font Size
children.help_text: This gives you control over the font size if it differs from you main body font.
